I actually think they are making a mistake by trying to balance Items and Champions at the same time - as there's no basis for comparison if both elements of the balancing process are stoic.

If you worked on Champions alone and left items out of the picture, there would be a lot more accuracy in your statistics - items affect different Champions at different stages of the game differently and when you start throwing different items around and changing them heaps - many imbalanced trends present themselves.

I think if you left items out of the picture you could change ratios and kits and actually achieve balance.

You see, that's wrong. 

They need to make updates to both items AND champions at the same time, otherwise stupid shit like cinderhulk will become rampant.

How do you balance items, without observing their performance with champions? I could have an item with 120 AD that I can activate to deal a small percentage of damage as well as increase all physical damage the target recieves by 50%, how do I know that is truly bad unless it's observed? Items should not be balanced within a vacuum, just like champions shouldn't.


They should be more proactive though. WoW releases hotfixes for broken stuff when they need to, rito patches whenever they feel like it, and stupid ass things like cinderhulk or Luden's Echo triggering the chain effect but causing the max amount of chain damage to be recieved by one target if there only was one will continue to happen for weeks.

I didn't jungle at the time that was out, nor did I even know how to play properly back then. I've only recently started playing again in the last 6 months or so.

But it's true though. They need to balance both items and champs at the same time as those two things work with each other. You can't play a champ without items (unless everybody agrees not to and that is stupid), and you can't use items without champions.

You can't balance items without seeing their actual impact on the game.

Yes you need to balance items and champs at the same time, but no, introducing and manipulating way too many variables on the table with every patch is bound to run into balance catastrophe, if they don't have someone who is literally living in the world of numbers and statistics doing the job.

However looking back at LoL's entire balance history it's pretty evident that they don't have such an individual working there, but they still wanna do it anyway.

So yeah.

Imo, they should start by reducing the amount of tweaks per patch, and let things stay in PBE for longer before officially releasing them into the actual game.
Yeah, I can agree with all of that. They need to be a bit quicker on patching/balancing the things making an immediate impact though, like the luden's glitch and other things.

Right now is pretty good time in terms of balance. I mean, there aren't really any "super OPs".

Granted {{champion:113}} and {{champion:55}} are pretty much permabanned, but they nerfed Sej and Kat recently, don't know what else they can do to stop them from being permabanned. Maybe tweak Sej's passive a bit?

Kat is just annoying in solo que but I think Sejuani has something like a 80% ban rate worldwide but still manages to have a top 3 winrate. So yeah... she's pretty strong.
